title: Drawing, "Christ and the Adulterous Woman", 1750–60
medium: Brush and gray wash, pen and brown ink, graphite on paper
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink, lower right: Francus Xaverius Mergolo F.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The woman, soldiers, and two disciples at left, Christ with others at right.  He points at the words He has written.  The woman rather undisturbed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Christ and the Adulterous Woman", 1750–60.
1750–60. Brush and gray wash, pen and brown ink, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4379.
